channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2024110019
item.description:
Report X-2024110019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-04T12:23:29+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-01
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN UNDECLARE PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE AND HAD NO DOT LABELS ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. 1X1 FLUID GALLON REGULATED METAL CAN OF RUSTOLEUM HEAT RESISTANT COATING METAL SOLVENT ALUMINUM COVER SEAL FAILED AND THE COVER BECAME LOOSE AND THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT STAINING THE WHOLE CAN AN INVOICE WAS INCLUDED THAT STATED ITEM #36ND74 RUSTOLEUM HEAT RESISTANT COATING METAL SOLVENT ALUMINUM WAS ENCLOSED. THE PACKAGE CONTAINS REGULATED ITEMS INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE WITH NO DOT LABEL ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE MAKING THE PACKAGE UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2024101724
item.description:
Report X-2024101724

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-01T09:15:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shipper placed barcode shipping label over Ltd Qty diamond printed on manufacturer's packaging obscuring more than 75% of the diamond. The contents of this pkg typically ship as Ltd Qty but due to the diamond being obscured it is being reported as Undeclared/NoSpill.

item.title: Report E-2024100705
item.description:
Report E-2024100705

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-31T09:22:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 15, 2024, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN1791 had faulty packaging and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the impacted site. ESI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1791-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon drum. The damaged 15-gallon drum was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged onsite for future disposal.
